001import java.util.Random;
002import java.util.Scanner;
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.io.*;
005
006/**
007 * Creates random numbers using Random lib
008 * 
009 * @author  Pavithra Subramaniyam;  pavithra.subramaniyam@tuni.fi;              
010 *                        
011 */
012
013
014public class RandomFruit {
015    // random number
016    private int ranNumber;
017    private Random random;
018    private Integer number;
019 
020    /**
021     * <p> generating random number with the range of given argument
022     *                  
023     * @param   getNumber   range
024     * @return  number      any random number                        
025     */
026
027    // getNumber = random maxim number
028    public Integer GetRandom(int getNumber) {
029 
030        //new random object
031        random = new Random();
032        ranNumber = random.nextInt(getNumber);
033        // wrap int into a object
034        number = ranNumber;
035        // return the random number
036        return number;
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * <p> checking whether the generated random number is within the range
041     *                   
042     * @param   i           given range
043     * @return  true|false  if condition                       
044     */
045
046
047    public Boolean NumberRange(int i) {
048        int a;
049 
050        RandomFruit num = new RandomFruit();
051        a = num.GetRandom(i);
052        if (a<i && a>=0){
053            return true;
054        } else {
055            return false;
056        }
057
058    }
059}
060
